page.title: 01DENTON VILLAGE
page.content: {Denton }is a picturesque village set in agricultural land. It was a thriving village based on open cast iron stone mining in the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries. The mining has now been discontinued but evidence can still be seen in the surrounding countryside.There are low lying fields where the iron stone was removed. The top soil has been restored,however,and crops and grass now grow on the fertile land. Many of the houses are built of iron stone giving them an attractive yellowish colour. Most of the village was owned by the Welby family. Sir Bruno Welby and his family still live in Denton Manor. Many of the older houses have now been sold to private owners who have restored and modernised them inside while retaining the original outside appearance.
